item.title: If apps don't offer speed, simplicity, and security, consumers will not hesitate to abandon them
item.description: Source: CA Technologies infographic. People are pickier than ever about the apps they use, so businesses that don’t offer a good app experience could lose a significant portion of their customers. A regional study* sponsored by CA Technologies shows that mobile and desktop applications in the Asia Pacific & Japan (APJ) region have become key to earning customer loyalty. item.title: Criteo analyzes shopping habits during Ramadhan 2016 in Southeast Asia
item.description: Online retail activity in Southeast Asia (SEA) sees a surge in the weeks leading up to and during Ramadan, according to data from performance marketing company Criteo. E-commerce sales escalate significantly, peaking in the third week of Ramadan with a 110% increase. However, online browsing and shopping decrease during sunset hours, likely due to the breaking of the daily fast. Post-fast, e-commerce activity experiences a resurgence, presenting a valuable opportunity for retailers.

item.title: The key to e-commerce success according to Akamai
item.description: Akamai, a content delivery network (CDN) provider, emphasizes the importance of speed in e-commerce, stating that slow loading times can lead to customer loss. They suggest two key ways online retailers can improve their businesses: by understanding modern customer behavior and by prioritizing speed, intelligence, and security in their online operations. Mobile shopping is a growing trend. Akamai’s data shows that mobile and tablet shoppers make purchases 20% more often and spend US$500 more than desktop users in the same timeframe, highlighting the need for strong mobile optimization.
